bio:treatment.discussion: In New England and Newfoundland, flowering phenology of Diapensia lapponica is bimodal (R. T. Day and P. J. Scott 1981). In some populations, one group of plants flowers in May through June, and another group flowers in a nonoverlapping period from late June through late August. The genetic basis for this has not been determined (M. M. Grandtner 1978).

references.reference: Day, R. T. and P. J. Scott. 1981. Autecological aspects of Diapensia lapponica L. in Newfoundland. Rhodora 83: 101–109.
Day, R. T. and P. J. Scott. 1984. The biology of Diapensia lapponica in Newfoundland. Canad. Field-Naturalist 98: 425–439.
